Payload.SurveyTitle: Online Survey Software | Qualtrics Survey Solutions

SurveyElements.SecondaryAttribute: Discriminative Turns When we engage in conversation with another person, we make use of the words...

Payload.QuestionText:
Discriminative Turns
When we engage in conversation with another person, we make use of the words being spoken and _the way that they are said_ to understand what someone means. The exact same phrase can be said in ways that mean completely different things.

Task
During each round of this task, you'll be presented with a set of phone conversation segments; each segment consists of a turn and a response in this form:
The initial turn
The response
OR
The initial turn
The response

Each set of audio segments contains the _true_ turn-response pair; the other segments are synthetic. Within each round of turn-response segments, you'll complete 5 experiments. Each experiment involves additional contextual information about the phone conversation.

Your task
in each experiment, your task is to assign each audio segment a score of how likely it is to be the real turn-response; where - 4: Very likely - 3: unsure/likely - 2: Unsure/unlikely - 1: Very unlikely
